result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession Of A Firearm By A Felon [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts 2 and 3; and consecutive to count 5.  Credit for 136 days.

Complete a Batterers Intervention Program.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No illegal drugs.
No use or possession of firearms.
No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay the domestic abuse assessment fee.
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory costs and all applicable surcharges including the DV and DNA surcharge and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory costs.  
-Court set restitution at $0.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Rhymes Petty

records.addlTxt: Count five.
Counts one, two and three.

Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Daniel Rhymes Petty.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan MIchaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent to counts 2, and 3, and consecutive to count 5, with credit for 136 days. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent to counts 1 and 3, and consecutive to count 5, with credit for 136 days. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, concurrent to counts 1 and 2, and consecutive to count 5, with credit for 136 days. 

AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction consecutive to all other counts, with 30 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0.

- Court waived all non-mandatory costs.  Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory costs and all applicable surcharges (including the DV and DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon s/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also s/he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Daniel Rhymes Petty.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan MIchaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 5:  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she must submit a DNA sample and may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 4: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO ALL COUNTS: Court dismissed the "Habitual Criminality Repeater".

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Received and Filed. AMENDED jury instructions for plea agreement (Disorderly Conduct)

Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Daniel Rhymes Petty.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case in court for Miranda Goodchild motion hearing.  Sworn for the state: Jesus Merced, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  Exhibits 1,2, and 3 received. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense.

Court placed on the record findings of fact and legal analysis. The Court DENIED the defense's motion.

Matter scheduled for SPEEDY Jury Trial.  Parties advise Court they ready to proceed with jury trial.  Case passed to address rest of Court's calendar.

Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 9/26/22 at 9:00 am in Branch 41.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 35
Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty, appear by video in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia, appear by video.  Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Merced. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; on vacation. Defense moves to dismiss. Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Daniel Rhymes Petty in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Rhymes Petty appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
